title: Man​ accused of shooting, killing 5-year-old brother​ in custody
content:
GREENSBORO, N.C. —
The 22-year-old Greensboro man accused of fatally shooting his 5-year-old brother on Friday voluntarily turned himself in to police.
Murad Anthony Weaver, who is charged with first-degree murder, turned himself in at about noon Tuesday to Greensboro police detectives.
The shooting happened at 11:32 p.m. at 816 Waugh St.
Investigators said the shooter's younger brother, Caleb Harris Pearson, was struck by a bullet late following an argument between Weaver, and his mother, Demetrius Michelle Harris, who was at the residence as a home health care provider.
Sources said Weaver fired the gun in anger without an intended target and fled the scene.
The nature of the dispute is unclear.
Pearson was taken to Moses Cone Hospital where he was pronounced dead at 12:03 a.m. Saturday.
On Monday, Harris begged for Weaver to turn himself in safely as she prepares to bury her other son.
"I want you to come so I can hold you and just tell you 'I forgive you," Demetrius Harris said. "He's still a kid who is hurting, so don't hate him for that. Because if I can't hate him ... that means you have the right not to hate him.
She said Caleb was wise beyond his years.
"Caleb was a smart, sweet, funny kid," Demetrius Harris said.
Services for Caleb are planned for Thursday.
Police said they are not looking for anyone else in connection with Pearson’s death, and that Weaver is cooperating with authorities.
